page.title: 15Bondleigh Architecture
page.content: {Variety}of architecture in 70 houses. {Burton Hall}(see tourism) Norwegian, wood construction, fire resistant, free of woodworm, brought in sections up Exeter canal 1870. Front of Burton Hall, being built into side of hill 12 {executive houses,}with double garages, basement services, ground floor living area, four bedrooms, one en suite lst. floor, built of thermal block, with fibre glass roof insulation and double glazing to reduce central heating costs.{Bouchers Hill}- elevated, late 19c.terraced stone with bay windows, high ceilings, overlooking N.Tawton, adjoining three modern bungalows and 3 storey red brick house.{20 cars for 11 {houses,}absence of garages and unmade service road are inadequate for l985. {Ashridge House}also unique.{Bondleigh many cob cottages, modernised/restored Devon longhouses; some new buildings.
